name: Kepler-22
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-22 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-22 is a star with 0.97 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.98 times its radius. It is located 619.6963999999999 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-22 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-22 system

Kepler-22 b

Kepler-22 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the Transit method. The mass of Kepler-22 b is 36 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-22 b is 2.38 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-22 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-22, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
